source_sentence: Kasāhipi tāḷenti, vettehipi tāḷenti, aḍḍhadaṇḍakehipi tāḷenti, hatthampi chindanti, pādampi chindanti, hatthapādampi chindanti, kaṇṇampi chindanti, nāsampi chindanti, kaṇṇanāsampi chindanti, bilaṅgathālikampi karonti, saṅkhamuṇḍikampi karonti, rāhumukhampi karonti, jotimālikampi karonti, hatthapajjotikampi karonti, erakavattikampi karonti, cīrakavāsikampi karonti, eṇeyyakampi karonti, baḷisamaṁsikampi karonti, kahāpaṇikampi karonti, khārāpatacchikampi karonti, palighaparivattikampi karonti, palālapīṭhakampi karonti, tattenapi telena osiñcanti, sunakhehipi khādāpenti, jīvantampi sūle uttāsenti, asināpi sīsaṁ chindanti.

source_sentence: Saha gāthāpariyosānā ye te brāhmaṇena saddhiṁ ekacchandā ekapayogā ekādhippāyā ekavāsanavāsitā, tesaṁ anekapāṇasahassānaṁ virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
translation: Other verses with them, together with those brahmin women, preserved the dreadful raising the sarong, the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma:
“Everything that has a beginning has an end.”

source_sentence: Tassa ca brāhmaṇassa virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi—
translation: And it was the stainless, immaculate vision of the Truth:
“Everything that has a beginning has an end.”

source_sentence: Saha dhammacakkhussa paṭilābhā ajinajaṭāvākacīratidaṇḍakamaṇḍalukesā ca massū ca antarahitā bhaṇḍukāsāyavatthavasano saṅghāṭipattacīvaradharo anvatthapaṭipattiyā pañjaliko bhagavantaṁ namassamāno nisinno hoti—
